olong  nThreads

Public: Allows Threads and sets number of processors which can be multithreaded.

No change is made if compilations did not have OBIT_THREADS_ENABLED

in Pointer to a ObitThread object.
nProc Number of threads

void ObitThreadInit (  ObitInfoList *  myInput  ) 
 

Public: Initialize Threading.

No change is made if compilations did not have OBIT_THREADS_ENABLED

Parameters:
myInput an ObitInfoList possible containing
  • "nThreads" OBIT_long (1,1,1) Number of threads to attempt per pool.

gboolean ObitThreadIterator (  ObitThread *  in,
olong  nthreads,
ObitThreadFunc  func,
gpointer **  args
) 
 

Public: Runs multiple copies of a function in different threads.

Waits for operations to finish before returning, 1 min timeout. Initializes Thread pool and asynchronous queue (ObitThreadPoolInit) if not already done. When threaded operations are finished, call ObitThreadPoolFree to release Thread pool.

Parameters:
in Pointer to object
nthreads Number of threads to create/run
func Function to call to start thread func should call ObitThreadPoolDone to indicate completion.
args Array of argument function pointers
Returns:
TRUE if OK else FALSE.

Public: Join thread.

Parameters:
in Pointer to object specifying thread to wait for..

Public: Lock (mutex) object.

Noop unless compiled with OBIT_THREADS_ENABLED

Public: Returns number of processors which can be multithreaded.

in Pointer to a Thread object

number of processors which can be threaaded, <=0 => no threading.

void ObitThreadRWReadLock (  ObitThread *  in  ) 
 

Public: Lock (RWLock) object for reader.

Other threads are allowed read access Noop unless compiled with OBIT_THREADS_ENABLED

Parameters:
in Pointer to object to be locked.

gboolean ObitThreadRWReadTryLock (  ObitThread *  in  ) 
 

Public: Test Lock (RWLock) object for reader.

If successful returns TRUE, if the object is already locked, returns FALSE immediatly. Noop unless compiled with OBIT_THREADS_ENABLED

Parameters:
in Pointer to object to be locked.
Returns:
TRUE if successful
